Unmarried voters boost Obama in new poll

Two new polls show President Obama leading Republican challenger Mitt Romney, with one survey offering an explanation: the marriage gap. (Globe, 11:03 a.m.)

Mass. officials announce ballot questions

Massachusetts voters will have the opportunity to weigh in on contentious issues such as medical marijuana and "aid in dying" come November. (AP, 12:08 p.m.)

Mom: 15-year-old son was harassed before fatal Dudley Square stabbing

The mother of the teen fatally stabbed in Roxbury said her son was the target of gang members who beat her son and chased him at school. (Globe, 1:17 p.m.)

Want your MTV? Not on DirecTV now

DirecTV Group Inc. stopped carrying channels owned by Viacom Inc. because of a contract dispute. They include MTV, Nickelodeon, and Comedy Central. (12:51 p.m.)

Report: Bay State residents living longer

Mass. residents are living longer while the number of deaths attributed to AIDS is declining, according to a state Public Health Department report. (AP, 12:48 p.m.)
